explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and oxygen (but not fluorine), with the chlorine and oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,033mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg, together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The available rat inhalation studies reported the LC50 value of >2.43mg/L, but there are no test data available for higher doses (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on test data from rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)): "The treated animals exhibited a Draize score of 0.7, but the effects were fully reversed within 48 hours."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In rabbit eye irritation tests, the only finding was conjunctival redness with a Draize score of 1 at 1 hour after application. The effects cleared up by 24 hours (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2004)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on positive data in in vitro micronucleus tests on mouse red blood cells, though in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests and mouse in vitro dominant lethal tests showed negative (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1979, 1985)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There was no evidence of treatment-related incidence of tumor formation observed in 2-year (rats) and 18-month (mice) carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1984, 1985)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on parental reproduction and offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1982, 1984, 1985)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including sedation, abnormal gait, lacrimation, prone position, muscular hypotonia, hyperventilation and blepharoptosis (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1985)). These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from ErC50=0.02mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=3.4(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.
